oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate enlisted man's saber
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This example stamped in two lines: "Memphis" and "Novelty Works," the only known example that is double-stamped. These sabers were produced under contract with the Confederate government. The grip is wrapped with tarred linen and twisted brass wire. Made after the firm merged with Charles Rigdon and the name changed to Leech & Rigdon.
